did.unittitle: Historica Critica sound recordings and videotapes 1984-1992
did.abstract: University of Michigan faculty group interested in the history of the university. Sound recordings and videotapes of interviews with former University of Michigan faculty, regents, administrators, and other interested individuals about the history of the university.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: Materials donated in a series of accessions, 1988-1992, by Historica Critica (Donor No. 7607).

accruals.p: Periodic additions to the records expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research, except where otherwise noted. Individual interview may be closed at the specification of the interviewee of for lack of a release from the interviewee.

The collection contains audio tapes from which digital copies have been made. Source tapes are for staff use only. Audio files are only available in the Bentley Historical Library reading room on designated Bentley Library computers.

userestrict.p: Except where otherwise noted in the finding aid, copyright has been transferred to the Board of Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Historica Critica sound recordings and videotapes, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

altformavail.p: Digitization: The Library has undertaken the digitization of a number of sound recordings within this collection. The resulting audio files are available for playback only in the Bentley Library Reading Room. Links to item images and additional information are available within this finding aid. Original sound recordings are only available for staff use.

bioghist.p: Historica Critica is a group of active and retired University of Michigan faculty and alumni who believe that the history of the university should be more fully studied, recorded, and celebrated. Toward these ends, Historica Critica has compiled video- and audiotapes of interviews with significant figures of the university faculty, administration, and alumni. The ultimate goal of Historica Critica is to bring about a comprehensive and scholarly history of the university through the use of these tapes.

Members of Historica Critica who have worked on the interview project include: Claude Eggertsen, School of Education; Allen Britton, School of Music Dean; Robert Iglehart, School of Art; Ralph Loomis, English Humanities; Allan Jones, Prakken Publications; Warner Rice, English; Arnold Kuethe, Aerospace Engineering; Arthur Gallagher, former editor of the Ann Arbor News.

Historica Critica has its own criteria for judging whether a member of the university community merits inclusion in its field of significant figures. These criteria, while undefined, seem to cast a net which primarily includes high-level university administrators, Regents, and emeritus faculty. Presidents Fleming and Hatcher; Vice-Presidents Smith, Niehuss, and Pierpont; Regents Roach and Power; and Emeritus faculty Ackley, William Bishop, Britton, Dow, Kuethe, Maurer, Rucknagel, Sears, and Wegman are among those interviewed. Men prominent on the local Ann Arbor scene are also included: Arthur Gallagher, editor of the Ann Arbor News; George Sallade, Ann Arbor Democrat; and Albert Wheeler, former mayor of Ann Arbor.

scopecontent.p: The materials in the Historica Critica collection are arranged first according to the medium on which the interview is preserved: Reel-to-Reel Audiotapes, Cassette Audiotapes, and Videotapes. Within each medium, the materials are in alphabetical order according to the subject of the interview. Some of the reel-to-reel audiotapes have more than one interview subject; these are arranged alphabetically according to the primary subject. It appears that the interviewers transferred the materials on reel-to-reel audiotapes directly to cassettes in several cases. This facilitates the arrangement of the cassettes into alphabetical order according to subject. The dates listed in the finding aid are the dates of the interview. Summaries of the interviews, prepared by Virginia Harris, are found in Box 1.

accessrestrict.p: [Digitized audio files are only available in the Bentley Historical Library reading room on designated Bentley Library computers.]

did.unittitle: Historica Critica; William W. Bishop, Jr., Eugene Power, 1987 February 10

did.abstract: (Tape 1; Eugene Power discussing Chairman of Governors Committee, Wayne University, sitting on Michigan State University's board, and change of Michigan State University's name.)

(Tape 1; William Bishop discussing his experiences at the University. Other names referenced or on this tape are: Warren Rice, Ralph Loomis, Alan Jones, Alan Brickman, and Claude Eggertsen discussing their experiences at the University.)

did.unittitle: Historica Critica; Unknown speaker, William W. Bishop, Jr., 1987 February 10

did.abstract: (Content becomes audible at 2:00. Content is not William Bishop, unidentified speaker discussing marching band history at the University of Michigan. )

(Tape 2; Begins with discussion of Admiral Peary and speaker being taken into Scientific Club Dick Hobbs is discussed; ends with discussion of prisoner of war treaties, and the need to get people interested in International Affairs; Professor of International law.)
(Tape 1; Interview with William Dow (Professor of Electrical Engineering) about his experiences at the University of Michigan.)

accessrestrict.p: [Digitized audio files are only available in the Bentley Historical Library reading room on designated Bentley Library computers.]

did.abstract: (Tape 2; Interview with William Dow (Professor of Electrical Engineering) about his experiences at the University of Michigan.)

(Tape 1; Interview with Wesley Maurer (Professor of Journalism), discussing his journalism experiences. Tape appears to slightly speed up and slow down periodically during recording, likely due to a faulty tape recorder.)
(Tape 2; Interview with Wesley Maurer (Professor of Journalism), discussing McCarthyism and the firings of professors at UM during the Red Scare.)

did.unittitle: Historica Critica; Marvin Niehuss, Harlan Hatcher, and Donald Rucknagel, 1987 February 20, 1986 May 27

did.abstract: (Tape 1; 1987 February 20; Donald Rucknagel (Professor of Human Genetics) discussing his experiences at the University of Michigan including events of the 1960s.)
(Tape 1; 1986 May 27; Marvin Niehuss, Professor of Law, Vice President, and Executive Vice President discussing his experiences at the University of Michigan.)

did.unittitle: Historica Critica; Marvin Niehuss, Harlan Hatcher, and Donald Rucknagel, 1987 February 20, 1987 April 27

did.abstract: (Tape 2; Unexpected content, brief excerpts of materials perhaps part of Historica Critica. Audio is only 0:28 long.)
(Tape 2; Unknown speaker (Marvin Niehuss?) discussing his experiences at the University of Michigan.)

(Tape 2; 1987 April 27, Interview with Harlan Hatcher, his early life, and experiences at the University of Michigan. Discussing finances, the expansion of the University, and the planning for North Campus.)

(Tape 2; 1987 April 27, Interview with Harlan Hatcher, his early life, and experiences at the University of Michigan. Discussing the development of the arts at Michigan, Football, and changes the environment at the University.)

did.unittitle: Historica Critica; Marvin Niehuss, Harlan Hatcher, and Donald Rucknagel, 1986 May 27

did.abstract: (Tape 3; Unidentified speaker discussing Harlan Hatcher's firing of Professors who were identified as Communists and the investigation by the House Un-American Activities Committee.)
(Interview with Wilbur Pierpont, Vice-President of Finance, ends with discussion of long range planning, including a discussion of North Campus proposals and solutions)
(Tape 1; Interview with George Sallade (Alumnus, Ann Arbor Democrat), discussing politics, education and the relationship between the University and local schools and the School of Education.)
(Tape 2; Interview with George Sallade (Alumnus, Ann Arbor Democrat) discussing his recollections at the University and his relationship with the University as a business owner.)

did.unittitle: Historica Critica; Allan Smith, Allan Britton, Robert Iglehart, 1986 October 29

did.abstract: (Interview with Allan Smith (Interim President); interviewed by Claude Eggersten, Alan Britton, and Robert Iglehart, ends with discussion of across the board salary increases; salary scales.)

did.unittitle: Historica Critica; Myron Wegman, John Sears, 1986 June 10

did.abstract: (Tape 1; Interview with Myron Wegman (Professor of Public Health) discussing his experiences at the University of Michigan.)

(Tape 2; Interview with Myron Wegman (Professor of Public Health) and John Sears (Professor in Medical School); Discussion on Health Service and student insurance; sufficient quantitative base; fee paid to health service; mistake made in writing the report; voluntary faculty/ mandatory students.)
(Tape 3; Interview with Myron Wegman (Professor of Public Health) and John Sears (Professor in Medical School); Discussion of tenure by-laws and problems with medical school)

scopecontent.p: The Videotapes series consists of videocassettes of interviews with Allan P. Britton, Robert H. Super, Claude Eggertsen, Wilfred Kaplan, Charles H. Sawyer, Phyllis M. Ocker, Robert Iglehart, Ronald C. Bishop, Charles Lehmann, Alfred Storey, and Robben W. Fleming concerning their activities at the University of Michigan.
